# Downlink time difference of arrival ranging

**API Collection**

Use anchor devices to improve the accuracy of indoor positioning.

## Overview

Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival (DL-DTOA) is a system that allows the Nearby Interaction framework to interact with fixed Ultra-wide band (UWB) devices — known as *anchors* — in an indoor space to increase the accuracy of positioning by measuring the time difference of arrival of signals from multiple anchors to an iOS device.

## Add the entitlement to your app

To use DL-DTOA, the system requires your app to have the `com.apple.developer.nearbyinteraction.dltdoa` entitlement with a value of `true`. Add this entitlement by enabling the Nearby Interaction DL-TDoA capability on your app’s target in Xcode. For more information, see  [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Xcode/adding-capabilities-to-your-app] to your app.



## Configuration

- **NIDLTDOAConfiguration**: A configuration that enables Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival ranging.

## Measurements

- **NIDLTDOAMeasurement**: Information from a Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival anchor that you use to derive a range estimate.
- **NIDLTDOACoordinatesType**: The possible coordinate types for Downlink Time-Difference-of-Arrival measurement updates.
- **NIDLTDOAMeasurementType**: The possible phases of downlink positioning signals.
